title: 2019 Will Be the Best Year for IPOs 'in Ages,' EY's Kelley Says
text: Jackie Kelley, EY Americas IPO leader, and Bloomberg's Elizabeth Fournier discuss the outlook for big tech initial public offerings with Bloomberg's Emily Chang on "Bloomberg Technology."

title: Investors should get more defensive in current market, says strategist
text: Kathryn Rooney Vera of Bulltick Capital Markets and CNBC's Mike Santoli discuss the markets wiht CNBC's "Closing Bell."

title: Peloton to remove classes with songs identified in copyright suit
text: CNBC's Diana Olick discusses breaking news from Peloton's CEO that the company will remove classes that feature songs identified in a copyright lawsuit by music publishers.

title: Orangetheory's 1,000,000,000 fitness empire
text: Orangetheory’s CEO David Long spoke with Yahoo Finance about how his company became a billion dollar behemoth in boutique fitness.

title: 'I think the market has more room to run,' says Mobius
text: Mark Mobius founder of Mobius Capital Partners discusses factors affecting the global economy and markets.

title: Energy, materials historically perform well with inverted yield curve, says macro analyst
text: Jeff deGraaf of Renaissance Macro Research discusses the inverted yield curve with CNBC's "Closing Bell."

title: Cramer, DataTrek's Colas Talk Lyft Ahead Of Anticipated IPO
text: This year will be a busy one for IPOs, but it pales in comparison to the "heyday" of the 1990s, DataTrek Research co-founder Nick Colas said.

title: Stocks typically outperform for a long time even when the bond market is flashing recession signal
text: Some investors may be freaked out over the recession signal being sent by interest rates, but if history is a guide, there is still time to capture more gains in the stock market.

title: Never ignore the yield curve, says Citi Private Bank chief economist
text: Steve Wieting, Citi Private Bank, and Greg Ip, WSJ, join 'The Exchange' to discuss yield curve concerns weighing on the market and if the U.S.-China trade deal could see an impact from the Mueller investigation.

title: Robinhood's First Acquisition Is Millennial-Focused Podcast And Newsletter MarketSnacks
text: Commission-free stock trading app Robinhood announced the acquisition Monday of millennial-focused podcast and newsletter company MarketSnacks.

title: Josh Brown: The US has never imported a recession and the consumer is 'on fire'
text: Recession fears have been reignited amid weakening global conditions, but recessions have never been contagious and the U.S. is doing just fine, according to Josh Brown.

title: Supreme is under siege by imitators. Here's why it's legal
text: Streetwear brand Supreme is loved by celebrities and valued at $1 billion. But overseas it's waging war against "legal fakes," companies that are legally imitating the brand in countries from Spain to China.

title: Global bond markets flash warning
text: Julie Hyman, Adam Shapiro, Brian Sozzi and Andy Serwer of Yahoo Finance look at what is going on with the bond market and the stock market.

title: Investors won't see great deals on IPOs because we're off market lows, says fintech expert
text: Brian Hamilton, co-founder of Sageworks, and CNBC's Mike Santoli discuss the wave of IPOs coming in 2019 and whether investors will see real opportunities to buy in.

title: Uber set to move on Middle East rival Careem | Squawk Box Europe
text: Uber is expected to announce the acquisition of its Middle East rival Careem as early as this week. CNBC's Dan Murphy reports.

title: US is hoping for a preliminary trade deal with China in two weeks
text: CNBC's Kayla Tausche reports on trade talks between the U.S. and China as they pick back up, this time in Beijing. Concerns that trade talks were falling apart grew after reports that China would be walking back some of its promises, but the U.S. is reportedly hoping to finalize some key agreements within the next couple of weeks.

title: Shades of Easy Money in Friday's Selloff, Analyst Shellady Says
text: Mar.25 -- In "Futures In Focus," Scott Shellady of TJM Investments examines the fallout from Friday's market selloff and concerns about a U.S. recession. He speaks with Bloomberg's Guy Johnson on "Bloomberg Markets."

title: Markets Can Move on From Impeachment Concerns, Valliere Says
text: Mar.25 -- Greg Valliere, chief U.S. strategist at AGF Investments, discusses the conclusion of Special Counsel Robert Muller's Russia probe and what comes next for the Democratic Party. He speaks with Bloomberg's Jonathan Ferro on "Bloomberg Markets: The Open."

title: Jim Cramer on eSports
text: Jim Cramer tackles eSports.

title: The FDA Proposes Tough New E-Cig Regulations
text: Teen use is the focal point of the new restrictions.

title: What Is A Recession Anyway?
text: Here's a new perspective on recessions: They're opportunities. Let's look at some ideas on how you can prepare for a recession and be ready to capitalize on those opportunities.

title: Stocks drop after opening slightly higher
text: CNBC's Bob Pisani looks ahead at the day's market action.

title: Global Bond Markets Underline Investor Concerns
text: Mar.25 -- Lale Topcuoglu, senor fund manager at JOHCM, Bob Michele, global chief investment officer at JPMorgan Asset Management, and Andres Garcia Amaya, founder and chief executive officer at Zoe Financial, discuss the global bond market rally and U.S. yield curve. They speak with Bloomberg's Jonathan Ferro on "Bloomberg Markets: The Open."

title: The US bond yield curve has inverted. Here's what it means
text: One of the most reliable recession indicators in the market got triggered on Friday and investors across the globe are starting to worry.

title: Add Risk to Bonds on Yield Curve Inversion, Sit's Doty Says
text: Mar.25 -- Bryce Doty, senior vice president at Sit Fixed Income, and Sylvia Jablonski, head of capital markets and institutional strategy at Direxion Investments, discuss investment strategies for bond and equity markets following the yield curve inversion. They speak on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Americas."

title: Uber May Buy Middle East Cab Hailing Rival Careem For $3.1 Billion
text: In a surprising move during the run-up to its initial public offering (IPO), Uber is reportedly in talks with its Middle Eastern on-demand cab hailing rival Careem to buy it for $3.1 billion, in a deal that is expected to be finalized early this week.

title: What You Need to Know About the Pinterest IPO
text: Pinterest has filed an S-1 form with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) regarding its initial public offering (IPO).

title: Lyft IPO From A Value Investor's Perspective
text: Lyft’s IPO promises to be one of the biggest initial public offerings of 2019.  The principles of fundamental analysis and value investing apply to all companies, no matter how exciting, so let’s break down what we know about the Lyft IPO using the tried and true value investing approach.

title: U.S. Yield Curve Inversion: Recession Fear vs. Reality
text: Mar.25 -- Bloomberg's Michael McKee examines recession signals from an inverted yield curve and explains why things may be different for the U.S. economy this time around. He speaks on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Americas."

title: Morgan Stanley: Get defensive because the inverted yield curve is sending a message
text: Investors should "remain defensively positioned" on stocks, Morgan Stanley's equity strategist Michael Wilson said on Monday.

title: Here's what Warren Buffett thinks about climate change and investing
text: Warren Buffett, Berkshire Hathaway CEO, owns many businesses exposed to climate change risks, from utilities to insurance companies.

title: How IPOs have changed in the past decade
text: Bob Davis, partner at Highland Capital Partners, joins "Squawk Box" to discuss how IPOs have changed in the past decade and what that means for the highly anticipated tech IPOs of 2019.

title: Pimco Sees Slowing Growth in Major Global Economies
text: Mar.25 -- Tony Crescenzi, market strategist and portfolio manager at Pimco, discusses his firm's 6-12 month outlook for the global economy. He speaks on "Bloomberg Surveillance."

title: Art Hogan talks markets
text: Art Hogan, National Decurities Chief Market Strategist, discusses the market fallout from the Mueller report, rising global weakness, and more

title: Deflation Is the Tail Risk Now for U.S., Economist Greene Says
text: Mar.25 -- Megan Greene, global chief economist at Manulife Asset Management, discusses the inverted yield curve, deflation risks, and the likelihood of a U.S. recession. She speaks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene on "Bloomberg Surveillance."

title: U.S. Lacks Signs of Recession Despite Yield Curve, RBC's Lignos Says
text: Mar.25 -- Elsa Lignos, global head of FX strategy at RBC, and Ben Ritchie, deputy head of European equities at Aberdeen Standard Investments, examine economic signals from gilts and the U.S. yield curve inversion. They speak on "Bloomberg Surveillance."

title: Tradeweb to offer 27.3 million shares in IPO priced at $24 to $26 each
text: Tradeweb Markets Inc., an operator of electronic marketplaces, set the terms for its planned initial public offering on Monday.

title: Chicago Fed president: I'm not worried about a recession | Street Signs Asia
text: Charles Evans, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago, says the fundamentals of the U.S. economy are still "quite strong," and he sees growth of between 1.75 percent to 2 percent in 2019.

title: Germany Has a Divided Economy, Ifo President Fuest Says
text: Mar.25 -- Clemens Fuest, president at Ifo, discusses the German March Ifo business confidence index, the state of the German economy, and a potential merger of Deutsche Bank AG and Commerzbank AG. He speaks on "Bloomberg Surveillance."

title: Tim Mullaney: Why you should let the Lyft IPO go by, and grab it when it comes around again
text: Looking at Lyft’s numbers, Tim Mullaney says he’d pass on the IPO and buy in later at a lower price.

title: Evans: Monetary Policy Almost Neutral
text: Mar.25 -- Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Charles Evans discusses the inversion of the yield curve, what it could mean, U.S. growth, the shift in Fed policy, his thoughts on employment, the impact the trade war has on Fed policy, China’s slowdown and his outlook for the global economy. He speaks on “Bloomberg Markets: European Open.”
